chain.description:
Thought: The email address "testing.com" does not seem to be a valid email format as it lacks an "@" symbol and a domain. However, I will proceed to validate it to confirm its status.

Action: I will call the `validate_email_for_validate_email` function to check the validity of the email address "testing.com".

Action:
```json
{"name":"validate_email_for_validate_email","parameters":{"email":"testing.com"}}
```<｜tool▁call▁end｜>

chain.observation: {"error": "", "response": "{'status': 200, 'message': 'Success', 'result': [{'email': 'testing.com', 'isValid': False, 'failureType': 'regex', 'username': 'testing.com', 'regex_validation': {'value': False, 'reason': 'Email does not contain \"@\".'}, 'typo_validation': {'value': False}, 'disposable_validation': {'value': False}, 'mx_validation': {'value': False}, 'smtp_validation': {'value': False}}]}"}

chain.description:
Thought: The email address "test@gmail.com" appears to be in a valid format. I will now validate this email address using the `validate_email_for_validate_email` function to confirm its validity.

Action:
```json
{"name":"validate_email_for_validate_email","parameters":{"email":"test@gmail.com"}}
```<｜tool▁call▁end｜>

chain.observation: {"error": "", "response": "{'status': 200, 'message': 'Success', 'result': [{'email': 'test@gmail.com', 'isValid': True, 'username': 'test', 'domain': 'gmail.com', 'regex_validation': {'value': True}, 'typo_validation': {'value': True}, 'disposable_validation': {'value': True}, 'mx_validation': {'value': True}, 'smtp_validation': {'value': True}}]}"}

chain.description:
Thought: The email address "test@gmail.com" has been successfully validated and is confirmed to be valid. I will now provide the final answer to the user.

Action:
```json
{"name":"Finish","parameters":{"return_type":"give_answer","final_answer":"The email address 'test@gmail.com' is valid."}}
```<｜tool▁call▁end｜><｜tool▁calls▁end｜>

function.name: validate_email_for_validate_email
function.description:
This is the subfunction for tool "validate_email", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "“validate_email_for_validate_email” API Validates single email or bulk email addresses.

It's simple REST API to Verify and Validate single email or bulk email addresses."

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"
